materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™   (Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m; Prints: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Sizes Small Large
Main Color (MC) Gold (7160) 3 4 O’Gos
Contrast A Jeweltone (7195) 3 4 O’Gos
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) and U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch markers.
Yarn needle.
24" x 72" x 1" [61 x 183 x 2.5 cm] slab of foam.
abbreviations: Hdchb = Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram)
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Small: 16" [40.5 cm] diameter x 2" [5 cm] tall, excluding points. Large: 24" [61 cm] diameter x 3" [7.5 cm] tall, excluding points.
gauge: 12 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. 8 hdc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook with 2 strands held tog.
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). BASE Notes: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as a st. All rnds are joined with sl st to first d c. With MC and smaller hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 1st rnd: (RS). Ch 2. 10 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 20 dc. 3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 dc. 4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 dc. 5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 dc. Cont as established, inc 10 dc every rnd, until there are 150 (230) dc. Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each dc around. Join. Fasten off. TOP Note: Rnds are worked in a continuous spiral. Do not join at end of rnds. With 2 strands of A held tog and larger hook, ch 2. 1st rnd: 10 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. 2nd rnd: 2 hdhb in horizontal bar created below next st (see diagram on page 1). PM on first of just made 2 sts. 2 hdchb in each hdc around. 20 hdc. 3rd rnd: *1 hdchb in next st. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 30 hdc. 4th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 40 hdc. 5th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 3 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 50 hdc. 6th rnd: 1 hdchb in each st around. 7th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 4 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 60 hdc. 8th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 5 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 70 hdc. 9th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 6 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 80 hdc. 10th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 7 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 90 hdc. 11th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 8 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 100 hdc. 12th rnd: As 6th rnd. Large size only: 13th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 9 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 110 hdc. 14th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 10 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 120 hdc. 15th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 11 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 130 hdc. 16th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 12 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 140 hdc. 17th rnd: *1 hdchb in each of next 13 sts. 2 hdchb in next st. Rep from * around. 150 hdc. Both sizes: Next rnd: 1 hdchb in each st to last 2 sts. 1 sc in horizontal bar below next st. 1 sl st in horizontal bar below next st. Fasten off. Side Note: All rnds are joined with sl st to first sc. With 2 strands of MC held tog and larger hook, ch 100 ( 150). Join with sl st to first ch, being careful not to twist ch. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 2 (3)" [5 (7.5) cm]. Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. PM on first unworked back loop of rnd (this marked rnd will be used for Finishing). Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Note: Beg working in rows. Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 80 ( 120) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 84 (124) sts. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 82 (122) sts. Rep last row once more. 80 (120) sts. Shape Points First Point: **1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 16 ( 24) sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 (18) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 14 (22) sts. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc t. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 (22) sts. Rep last row 4 ( 9) times more. 4 sts. Next row: (Sc2tog) twice. Fasten off. ** With RS facing and larger hook, join 2 strands of MC with sl st to next unworked sc. Work from ** to ** as given for First Point 4 times more, working 5 Points in total. Edging: With RS facing and larger hook, join 2 strands of MC with sl st to any st. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 rnd of reverse sc around entire upper edge, working 3 reverse sc into tip of each Point. Join. Fasten off. FINISHING With WS of Base and Side facing each other and larger hook, join 2 strands of MC to any st. Working through both thicknesses, ch 1. Work sc evenly around to join Base and Side tog. Join. Fasten off. Using a serrated knife, cut 2 ( 3) circles of foam 16 ( 24)" [40.5 ( 61) cm] in diameter. Stack foam circles and place on Base of Bed. Place Top of Bed on foam circles. With larger hook, join 2 strands of A with sl st to any st of last rnd of Top and unworked back loop of marked rnd of Side. Working through both thicknesses, ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc. Join. Fasten off. Pompoms (make 5): Wind A around 3 fingers approx 50 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew pompom to tip of each Point.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Main Color (MC) Sand (10014) 4 balls or 795 yds/727 m
Bernat® Blanket™ (5.3 oz/150 g; 108 yds/98 m) Contrast A Taupe (10029) 1 ball or 89 yds/81 m
Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (5.3 oz/150 g; 108 yds/98 m) Contrast B Go-Go Green (13004) 1 ball or 76 yds/70 m
Contrast C Race Car Red (13001) 1 ball or 59 yds/54 m
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stuffing.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 8 sc and 7 rnds = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook and 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
With larger hook and 2 strands of MC held tog, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
9th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
10th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
11th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sc.
12th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sc.
13th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
14th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 104 sc.
15th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 112 sc.
16th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
17th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 120 sc.
18th rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
19th to 21st rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
22nd rnd:  Join 2 strands of A held tog. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
23rd and 24th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
25th rnd:  With smaller hook, join 1 strand of B, working in front loops only, 2 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 240 sc. 
26th rnd:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in first sc. 3 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *3 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to stop of beg ch. Fasten off. 
27th rnd: With larger hook, join 2 strands of C held tog, working in back loops only from 24th rnd, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
28th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off. 
29th rnd:  Join 2 strands of MC held tog. Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 112 sc.
30th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 104 sc.
31st rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sc. 
32nd rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sc.
33rd rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only , *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
Note: Begin stuffing bed as dec rnds are worked to ensure uniformity.
34th and alt rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
35th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sts.
37th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sts.
39th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sts.
41st rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
43rd rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sts.
45th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
47th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
49th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
50th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sc. Fasten off.
Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ O’Go™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Version 1: Art Nouveau (42022) 2 O’Gos
Version 1: Milk and Honey (42005) 2 O’Gos
Version 2: Atlantic (42017) 2 O’Gos
Version 2: Agave (42010) 2 O’Gos
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
Heavy duty shipping packing tape.
Utility knife.
Straight edge for cutting.
2 pieces of cardboard each 5" [12.5 cm] wide x 41" [104 cm] long or 1 piece of 20" x 30" [51 x 76 cm] plastic corrugated board.
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
Splhdc = Split half double crochet: work hdc between ‘legs’ at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops.
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] diameter x 14½" [37 cm] tall.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. 
• Pull tie to remove. 
• Colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• Designate each color A, B, C, D, E, F as indicated in Materials.
• Start crocheting!
BASE
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 7 hdc.
Cont working in spiral as follows:
2nd rnd:  2 splhdc in each hdc around. 14 sts.
3rd rnd: *2 splhdc in next st. 1 splhdc in next st. Rep from * around. 21 sts.
4th rnd:  *2 splhdc in next st. 1 splhdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 28 sts.
5th rnd:  *2 splhdc in next st. 1 splhdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 35 sts.
6th rnd:  *2 splhdc in next st. 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. 42 sts.
7th rnd:  *2 splhdc in next st. 1 splhdc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 49 sts.
8th rnd:  *2 splhdc in next st. 1 splhdc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. 56 sts.
9th to 14th rnds:  Cont in this manner, inc 7 sts each rnd, until there are 98 sts.
15th rnd:  *2 splhdc in next st. 1 splhdc in each of next 13 sts. Rep from * around. 105 sts.
16th rnd: *(2 splhdc in next st. 1 splhdc in each of next 11 sts) twice. 2 splhdc in next st. 1 splhdc in each of next 10 sts. Rep from * around.  114 sts.
Join with sl st to first st of last rnd. 
Fasten off.
Sides and Opening
Notes:
• Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through rem loops and proceed with new color.
• Ch 1 at beg of rows/rnds does not count as st.
Proceed with Side as follows:
1st rnd: (RS). With RS facing, join B with sl st to back loop only of any st of Base. Ch 1. 1 hdcbl in same st as last sl st. 1 hdcbl in each st around.
Cont working in spiral as follows:
2nd and 3rd rnds:  1 splhdc in each st around.
Join with sl st to first st of last rnd. 
Turn.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 splhdc in each of first 96 sts. Join C. Break A. 
Turn, leaving rem sts unworked.
Cont working in rows for Opening as follows:
1st row: (RS). With C, ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
96 sts.
2nd and 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st to end of row. Turn. Join B. Break C.
5th row: With B, ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 96 sts.
6th to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Join C. Break B.
9th to 11th rows: Rep 1st to 3rd rows once more.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st to end of row. Join D. Break B.
13th and 14th rows: With D, ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st to end of row. 
Turn.
Join E. Break D.
15th row: With E, ch 1. 1 splsc in each st to end of row. Ch 18. Join with sl st to first st being careful not to twist ch. Fasten off.
TOP
Notes: 
• Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
• Carry color when not in use loosely up WS of work, unless otherwise stated.
Proceed in rnds as follows:
1st rnd: (RS). Join E with sl st to any st at back of Nest (side across from opening). Ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st to ch-18 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 18 ch. 1 splhdc in each st to end of rnd. Join F. 114 sts.
Cont working in spiral as follows:
2nd rnd:  With F, skip first ch. 1 splhdc in each st around.
3rd rnd: *Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 17 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join D. 108 sts.
4th rnd: With D, 1 splhdc in each st around.
5th rnd: *1 splhdc in each of next 8 sts. Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join E. 102 sts.
6th rnd: With E, 1 splhdc in each st around.
7th rnd: *Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 15 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join F. 96 sts.
8th rnd: With F, 1 splhdc in each st around.
9th rnd: *1 splhdc in each of next 7 sts. Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join D. 90 sts.
10th rnd:  With D, *Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 13 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. 84 sts.
11th rnd: *1 splhdc in each of next 6 sts. Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join E. 78 sts.
12th rnd:  With E, *Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 11 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. 72 sts.
13th rnd: *1 splhdc in each of next 5 sts. Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. 66 sts.
14th rnd:  With F, *Splshdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. 60 sts.
15th rnd: *1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. Splshdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join D. 54 sts.
16th rnd:  With D, *Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. 48 sts.
17th rnd: *1 splhdc in each of next 3 sts. Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join E. 42 sts.
18th rnd:  With E. *Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. 36 sts.
19th rnd: *1 splhdc in each of next 2 sts. Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join F. 30 sts.
20th rnd: With F, *Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join E. 24 sts.
21st rnd: *Splshdc2tog. 1 splhdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join D. 18 sts.
22nd rnd:  With D, *Splhdc2tog. 1 splhdc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. 12 sts.
23rd rnd:  *(Splhdc2tog) 6 times. 
6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long Tail.
Weave Tail through tops of rem 6 sts and pull tight to close hole at top of Nest. Fasten securely.
FINISHING
Edging: (RS). Join C with sl st to any st around Opening. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around opening. Join with sl st to top of first sc.
Fasten off.
Internal Structure  (as shown in diagram on page 4)
Note: If working with 20" x 30" [51 x 76 cm] piece of plastic corrugated board, cut 2 long pieces 5" [12.5 cm] wide x 30" [76 cm] long and 4 short pieces 5" [12.5 cm] wide x 10" [25.5 cm] long. Taking 1 long piece and 2 short pieces, join tog with 1 short piece overlapping long piece by 4½" [11.5 cm] at each end to form 1st board measuring 5" [12.5 cm] wide x 41" [104 cm] long. Wrap tape around pieces to secure in place. Rep for second set of 1 long piece and 2 short pieces to form 2nd board.
Take first 5" [12.5 cm] wide x 41" [104 cm] long board and curve to fit inner shape of domed top of Nest, making sure short ends of board meet edge of Base and board runs across the diameter of the base beg inside right-hand side of Opening.
Rep for 2nd board beg inside left-hand side of Opening and crossing the 1st board at center of domed top of Nest.
Note: If working with heavier board, you may need to score the width of boards every 2" [5 cm] across center 20" [51 cm] section to ensure you can achieve a smooth curve across domed top of Nest.
Join center of crossed boards together with tape to secure in place.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go® (Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m; Prints: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Main Color (MC) Dusty Gray (7140) 7 O’Gos
Contrast A,B,C,D & E: Rainbow (7192) 2 O’Gos
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
3" [7.5 cm] thick piece of foam 16" x 24" [40.5 x 61 cm].
4" [10 cm] thick piece of foam 16" x 24" [40.5 x 61 cm].
Quilt batting.
Hot glue gun and glue sticks.
measurements: Blanket: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] square. Couch: Approx 24" [61 cm] long x 16" [40.5 cm] deep x 12" [30.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
Notes: • To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. • Pull tie to remove.
BLANKET (Make 3 Granny Square Motifs each in Contrast A, B, C and E, and make 4 in D).
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. Ch 2. (3 dc in ring. Ch 2) 3 times. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in first ch-2 sp. [(Ch 1. 3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in first corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. [(Ch 1. 3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) all in next in corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 dc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in first corner ch-2 sp. *(1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join. Fasten off.
Assembly: Sew Squares together into 4 Strips, with 4 Squares in each Strip (see assembly diagram). Sew Strips together. Edging: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Blanket, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

COUCH Couch Cushions – Part A (make 2): **With MC, ch 46.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 45 sts.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm], ending on a RS row.**
Next row: (WS). Sl st in each of first 12 sts. Ch 2 ( does not count as st). 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 33 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm]. Fasten off.

Couch Cushions – Part B (make 2): Work from ** to ** as given for Couch Cushions – Part A.
Next row: (WS) Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to last 12 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 33 sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm]. Fasten off.

Finishing Couch Cushions: Cut 6 pieces of Quilt batting to match dimensions of Cushion. With WS facing each other, place one Part A and one Part B together. With RS of Part A facing, join MC with sl st to any corner of Cushion. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around perimeter of Cushion, working 3 sc in each corner, stopping to insert 3 layers of quilt batting into Cushion before joining last side. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Rep for second cushion, with RS of Part B facing.

Base of Couch: With MC, ch 16.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 15 sts.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 80" [203 cm]. Fasten off.

Couch Seat and Back Cushion: With MC, ch 92.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 91 sts.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Next row: Sl st in each of first 12 sts. Ch 2 ( does not count as st). 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to last 12 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Proceed as follows:
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 67 sts.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 16" [40.5 cm], ending on a RS row.

Increase rows:
1st row: (WS). Ch 13. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 dc in next ch. (1 sc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch) 5 times. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 14. 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. (1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 5 times. 1 dc in next st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 91 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
4th row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg 21" [53.5 cm]. Fasten off.

Back of Couch and Top: With MC, ch 116.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 115 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Next row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 12 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in next dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last 12 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 dc in first sc. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 91 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 11" [28 cm]. Fasten off.

Armrests (make 2): With MC, ch 38.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 37 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off.

Armrests Ends (make 2): With MC, ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 11 sts.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm]. Fasten off.

Dust Ruffle: Note: Do not separate shades for Dust Ruffle. After cutting and removing plastic tie, start crocheting! With Contrast A, ch 212.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 210 sts,
2nd row: Ch 2. 3 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. 630 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 dc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

Bottom: With MC, ch 92.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 91 sts.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 dc in first st. *1 sc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 dc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 16" [40.5 cm]. Fasten off.

Foam Foundation: Note: When cutting foam, using a serrated (bread) knife will allow greater control. Cut the following pieces from 3" [7.5 cm] thick foam: Piece A: Back One piece measuring 8" x 24" [20 x 61 cm]. Pieces B and C: Armrests Two pieces measuring 3" x 10" [7.5 x 25.5 cm]. Using hot glue gun, assemble pieces on 4" [10"] slab of foam (D) measuring 16" x 24" [40.5 x 61 cm] as shown in diagram.

Couch Cover Assembly: See Assembly Diagram. Sew Back/Top section to Back Cushion and Seat as indicated in purple. Sew Armrests to Seat as indicated in blue. Sew corners of Back as indicated in red. Sew Back to Back Cushion as indicated in grey. Sew Armrest to Back Cushion and Back as indicated in orange and yellow. Sew Armrest Ends to Armrest and seat as indicated in pink. Sew Base to perimeter of Couch as indicated in green. Sew Dust Ruffle to Base as shown in photo, covering front and sides. Affix assembled Couch Cover to foam foundation. Tack with yarn and yarn needle or hot glue if needed to secure cover. Sew Bottom to lower edge of Base.

pattern_name: DONUT ASK ME TO WAKE UP CROCHET PET BED
materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Taupe (10029) 4 balls or 800 yds/731.5 m
Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Flowerpot (04329) OR Strawberry Dot (04892) 3 balls or 660 yds/603 m
Size U.S L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Stuffing.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions: Note:  Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting. With A, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join, cont working in spiral as follows. PM (first marker) for beg of rnd. Move marker up on rnds as work progresses. PM. 6 sc. 2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc. 3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc. 4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. 5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc. 6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc. 7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc. 8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc. 9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 54 sc. 10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 60 sc. 11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 66 sc. 12th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 72 sc. 13th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 78 sc. 14th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 84 sc. 15th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 13 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 90 sc. 16th rnd: Break A. Join B. With B, working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. 17th to 28th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 29th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 96 sc. 30th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 31st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 102 sc. 32nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 33rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 108 sc. 34th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 17 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 114 sc. 35th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 18 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 120 sc. 36th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 19 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 126 sc. 37th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 20 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 132 sc. 38th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 21 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 138 sc. 39th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 22 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 144 sc. 40th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 23 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 150 sc. 41st rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 24 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 156 sc. 42nd rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 25 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 162 sc. 43rd rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 26 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 168 sc. 44th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 27 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 174 sc. 45th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 28 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 180 sc. 46th to 55th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 56th rnd:  Working in back loops only,  1 sc in each sc around. Break B. Join A. 57th to 67th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each sc around. 68th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 28 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 174 sts. 69th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 70th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 27 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 168 sts. 71st rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 72nd rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 26 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 162 sts. 73rd rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 25 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 156 sts. 74th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 24 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 150 sts. 75th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 144 sts. 76th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 22 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 138 sts. 77th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 132 sts. 78th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 126 sts. 79th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 19 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 120 sts. 80th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 18 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 114 sts. 81st rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 17 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 108 sts. 82nd rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 102 sts. 83rd rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 96 sts. 84th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 90 sts. 85th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 84 sts. 86th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 78 sts. 87th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 72 sts. 88th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 66 sts. 89th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 60 sts. 90th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 54 sts. 91st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 48 sts. 92nd rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 42 sts. 93rd rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 36 sts. 94th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sts. Stuff ring of Donut firmly and bottom of bed softly. 95th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts. 96th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts. 97th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts. 98th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts. Large Icing Drips (make 5). With B, ch 9. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 17 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. 3 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc. 20 sc. Fasten off. Small Icing Drips (make 5). With B, ch 3. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 5 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 3 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in last sc. 8 sc. Fasten off. Sew Icing Drips to front loops of 55th rnd, alternating between large and small sizes, having them evenly placed - approx every 18 sts.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Jade (3862) 1 ball or 155 yds/141 m
Contrast B Minty (520) 1 ball or 280 yds/256 m
Contrast C Lemon (235) 1 ball or 100 yds/91 m
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® split-lock stitch count markers
Susan Bates® yarn needle
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] x 25" [63.5 cm] before assembly, excluding straps.
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
Stripe Pat
With B work 5 rows
With A work 2 rows.
These 7 rows form Stripe Pat.
HAMMOCK
With B, ch 83.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 81 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd to 5th rows: As 2nd row. Change to A at end of 5th row.
6th and 7th rows: With A, as 2nd row.
Change to B at end of 7th row.
First 7 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
8th to 49th rows: Rep Stripe Pat 6 times more.
50th to 54th rows: With B, as 2nd row.
BORDER
Join C with sl st to any corner of Hammock. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Work sc evenly around, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
MAIN STRAPS (make 2)
With C, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Strap measures 45" [114.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Measure 10" [25.5 cm] from each end of Strap and PM at each end of that row for placement of Tie Straps.
TIE STRAPS (make 4)
1st row: With RS facing, join C with sl st around post of first marked sc on Main Strap. 1 sc around post of next sc of same marked row. 1 sc around post of last marked sc. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until Tie Strap measures 10" [25.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Rep on opposite end of Main Strap, then rep for rem Main Strap.
FINISHING
With WS facing, align Main Strap over first 5 rows of Hammock. Fold Hammock edge over Main Strap so that 1st row meets 5th row. With B, join 1st and 5th rows tog, over Main Strap. Rep with last 5 rows of Hammock with rem Main Strap.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (14 oz/400 g; 431 yds/394 m)
Grey Ragg (30047) 3 4 5 5 balls
Sizes U.S. J/10 (6 mm) and M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Quilt batting.
2" [5 cm] button.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 6 dc and 3½ rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands held tog and larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.
Notes:
• Base and Edging are worked holding 2 strands of yarn tog throughout.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.

Base (make 2)
With 2 strands of yarn held tog and larger hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc.
*2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 72 dc.
Sizes M, L and XL only: 7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 84 dc.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 96 dc.
9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 108 dc.
Sizes L and XL only: 10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 120 dc.
11th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 132 dc. 
*2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 72 dc.
12th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 144 dc.
Size XL only: 13th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 156 dc.
14th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 168 dc. Fasten off.

Edging
With 2 strands of yarn held tog and larger hook, ch 74 (110-146-170).
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 72 (108-144-168) dc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next dc. Dcbp around next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep last row until Edging measures approx 5" [12.5 cm] Do not fasten off.
Join sides tog, working 1 row of sc through both thicknesses. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Cut quilt batting to match outer measurement of Base.
With WS of Base pieces tog and larger hook, join 2 strands of yarn held tog in any dc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each dc around, stopping just past halfway point to place quilt batting inside Base. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Position Edging around outside edge of Base, stretching just slightly to fit. With larger hook, join 2 strands of yarn held tog with sl st to any sc around Base. Ch 1. Join Edging to Base, working 1 rnd of sc through both thicknesses. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Button Cover
With 1 strand of yarn and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 16 sts. Insert button.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts. Fasten off leaving a long end.
Attach Button to center of Base, making sure to secure tightly through all thicknesses to bottom of Base.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Pet™ (8 oz/225 g; 269 yds/246 m)
Contrast A Navy (34022) 2 3 balls
Contrast B Teal (34019) 3 4 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Black worsted weight yarn for embroidery.
Safety eyes and nose.
gauge: 8 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions: The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to both sizes. For ease in working, circle all numbers pertaining to your size. Bottom (make 1 each with A and B) With 2 strands of yarn, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 18 sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 24 sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 30 sc. 6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 36 sc. 7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 42 sc. 8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 48 sc. Cont in same manner, inc 6 sts every rnd until work measures approx 20 (32)" [ 51 (81.5) cm] in diameter. Fasten off Base A. Place WS of Bases A and B tog, having B as outer piece (do not fasten off Base B). Joining rnd: With B, working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Rep last rnd until work from joining rnd measures 4" [10 cm]. Ears: PM on center front st. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 6 sc before marked sc. *Skip next 2 sc. 8 tr in next sc. Skip next 2 sc.* 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. With black yarn, embroider whiskers and nose using straight stitch. Following manufacturer’s instructions, attach eyes.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra Thick™ (21.2 oz/600 g; 72 yds/66 m)

abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops.
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] diameter x 5" [12.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
With A, ch 2 loosely.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 7 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join.  21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 28 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 35 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc. PM at end of rnd.
Sides of bed: 7th rnd:  With A, 1 splsc in first sc. *With B, 1 splsc in next sc. With A, 1 splsc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. With B, 1 splsc in last sc. Join.
8th rnd: With B, 1 splsc in first sc. *With A, 1 splsc in next sc. With B, 1 splsc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. With A, 1 splsc in last sc. Join.
Rep last 2 rnds, alternating A and B until work from marked rnd measures 6" [15 cm]. Break A. 
Next rnd:  With B, ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 35 sts. 
Next rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 28 sts. 
Next rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 sts. 
Lightly stuff with fiberfill.
Next rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 14 sts. 
Next rnd: (Sc2tog) 7 times. Join. Fasten off. 
Push one half into another to create basket shape as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Pet™ (8 oz/225 g; 269 yds/246 m) Navy (34022) 5 balls

instructions:
Front and Back (make alike)
Note: After 1st rnd, join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 15 dc in ring. Join. 16 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch-2 throughout). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. 1 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 5. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each dc to next ch-2 sp. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each dc to next ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. 1 dc in first ch-2 sp. Join.
Rep 3rd rnd, inc 16 sts per rnd, until work measures approx 36" [91.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Join: With WS tog, join yarn with sl st to any corner ch-2 sp. Working through both thicknesses, join edges with 1 rnd of sc, inserting pillow form before joining last edge. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Buttons: Measure and mark center of Pillow. Thread a long, sharp sewing needle and pierce through center of Pillow. Cinch tightly. Sew one button to top and bottom of Pillow at center.

pattern_name: Pawsome Patchwork Crochet Granny Square Pet Bed

Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® steel yarn needle.
12¾" [32.5 cm] wide x 14¾" [37.5 cm] deep x 12¾" [32.5 cm] tall storage cube.

Tape measure.
measurements: Approx 12¼" [31 cm] wide x 14¼" [36 cm] deep x 12¼" [31 cm] tall (will stretch to fit storage cube).
gauge: 12 double crochet (dc) and 7.5 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions: USING THIS GUIDE Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools. NOTES • Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in. • Each color aligns with 1 rnd in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. • When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif. • Granny Square how to: https://www.yarnspirations.com/pages/how-to-granny-square-guide MOTIF With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join. 2nd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. 3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. 4th and 5th rnds: Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. **(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. COVER MOTIFS Motifs: Make 8 each in A, B, and C (total of 24 Motifs). FINISHING Note: Finished cover will stretch to fit storage cube. Joining Pieces (Right Side, Back, Left Side, Front) Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). With D, sl st Motifs tog as shown in Assembly Diagrams I (creating Right Side, Left Side, Back and Front), working through back loops only, ensuring RS up on all Motifs, and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram). Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS. Back Cover Border: 1st row: (RS). Join D with sl st to upper right corner ch-3 sp of C Motif. Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 1 dc in same ch-3 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp) twice. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. 2 dc in last ch-3 sp across top edge of Back. Turn. 34 dc. 2nd row: (WS). Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch-1). (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 11 times. 1 dc in last dc (top of ch-3). Turn. 35 dc. 3rd row: (RS). Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 1 dc in same ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 10 times. Ch 1. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. Turn. 34 dc. Rep 2nd and 3rd rows until Border measures 3" [7.5 cm], ending on a RS row. Fasten off. Folding and Seaming Cover: Seaming with Flat Sl St Join and D, fold Cover tog and join seams as shown in Cover Assembly Diagram III. Opening Edging (see diagram on page 8). 1st rnd: (RS). Join D with sl st to first ch-1 sp at bottom right edge of opening along top edge of B Motif. Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 2 dc in same ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp) twice. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next: 3 dc, each of next 2 ch-3 sps, and next 3 dc. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp) twice. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp) twice. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 3 dc, ch-1 sp, and 3 dc. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp) twice. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp) twice. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 3 dc, each of 2 ch-3 sps, and next 3 dc. Join with sl st in first dc (top of first ch-3). PILLOW Motifs: Make 3 each with A and B, make 2 with C (total of 8 Motifs). FINISHING Joining Pillow Pieces (Front, Top Back, Bottom Back) Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). With D, sl st Motifs tog as shown in Pillow Assembly Diagram, working through back loops only, ensuring RS up on all Motifs, and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram on page 5). Bottom Back Pillow Border: Work as for Back Cover Border, joining D with sl st to upper right corner ch-3 sp of A Motif to work across top edge and only (see Pillow Assembly Diagram). Top Back Pillow Border: Rep 1st row only of Back Cover Border, joining D with sl st to lower left corner and turning work to work across bottom edge of Top Back (See Pillow Assembly Diagram). Joining Front and Back Pillow: Overlap Back pieces to match Front, with Border sections in center to create opening to insert pillow form. With WS tog, join C with sl st to any corner st of Pillow. Ch 1. Working through all thicknesses, work sc evenly around 4 sides of Pillow, having 4 sc in each corner. Fasten off. Insert pillow form and place Pillow in Pet Bed as shown.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra Thick™ (21.2 oz/600 g; 72 yds/66 m) Rose (62023) 4 balls or 280 yds/256 m
Size U.S. S [19 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® stitch marker
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 18" [45.5 cm] diameter x 6" [15 cm] high.
instructions:
Note
• Join all rnds with sl st in first sc.
Increasing Section
See Diagrams on page 2.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc. 
8th rnd: As 6th rnd. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc. PM at end of last rnd. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 15" [38 cm]. 
Decreasing Section
1st rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sts. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sts. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. 8 sts. Join. Fasten off. 
Push one half into another to create basket shape with side edges as shown in picture.

abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.

instructions:
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.

4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 40 sc.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Main Color (MC) Pretty ‘n Pink (0722) 4 balls
Contrast A Minty (0520) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Safety pins.
Susan Bates® locking stitch markers.
3" [7.5 cm] thick foam slab 24" [61 cm] square.
5" [12.5 cm] thick foam slab 13" [33 cm] long by 24" [61 cm] wide.
Polyfill stuffing for Bolster Pillow.
Optional catnip.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.

Lnkdc = Insert hook down through lower horizontal bar in center of previous lnktr, yoh and draw up a loop. Insert hook in next stitch (through top loops in usual manner), yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops on hook – Linked Dc made.

Lnkdtr = Insert hook down through horizontal bar in center of previous lnkhdc, yoh and draw up a loop. Insert hook down through horizontal bar in right-most hdc one row below and draw up a loop. Insert hook down through horizontal bar in right-most hdc two rows below and draw up a loop. Draw up a loop in next unworked stitch three rows below. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times – Linked Double Treble made.
Lnkhdc = Draw up a loop in center loop from previous stitch. Draw up a loop in next hdc (through top loops in usual manner). Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Linked Hdc made.

Lnkhdc2tog = Draw up a loop in centre loop from previous st. Draw up a loop in next hdc (through top loops in usual manner). Yoh and draw up a loop in next hdc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. – Linked Hdc2tog made.

Lnktr = Insert hook down through second lowest horizontal bar in center of previous lnkdtr, yoh and draw up a loop. Insert hook down through lowest horizontal bar in center of previous lnkdtr, yoh and draw up a loop. Draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through first 2 loops on hook) 3 times – Linked Tr made.
measurements: Approx 27" [68.5 cm] wide x 13" [33 cm] deep x 13½" [34.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
BASE
See diagram on page 9.
With MC, ch 66.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 64 hdc
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 24" [61 cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to last 12 hdc. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. Cont on rem 52 hdc.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. 52 hdc. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 27" [68.5 cm]. Fasten off.
BACK PANEL
See diagram on page 9. With MC, ch 98.
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 lnkhdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 96 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 96 sts.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 7" [18 cm], ending on a RS row.
Proceed with short-row shaping as follows:
See diagram on page 8.
1st row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to last 20 sts. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. 76 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to last 4 sts. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. 72 sts.
Rep last 2 rows 10 times more, ending on a 2nd row. 32 sts.
Resolving short rows
See diagram on page 8. Next row: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each of next 31 sts. (Working into next unworked st 3 rows below, 1 lnkdtr in next st. 1 lnktr in next st. 1 lnkdc in next st. 1 lnkhdc in next st) 11 times. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Fasten off. 96 sts.
SEAT
See diagram on page 9.
With MC, ch 98.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 lnkhdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 96 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Ch 22. Turn, being careful not to twist chain.
Next row: 1 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 lnkhdc in each of next 19 ch. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 116 sts. PM on last st.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marked row measures 13" [33 cm], ending on a WS row.
Dec row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to last 20 sts. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. Cont on rem 96 sts.
Next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from dec row measures 2" [5 cm], ending after a WS row.
Proceed with short-row shaping as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to last 20 sts. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. Cont on rem 76 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to last 4 sts. Turn, leaving rem sts unworked. 72 sts.
Rep last 2 rows 10 times more, ending on a 2nd row. 32 sts.
Resolving short rows: Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each of next 31 sts. (Working into next unworked st 3 rows below, 1 lnkdtr in next st. 1 lnktr in next st. 1 lnkdc in next st. 1 lnkhdc in next st) 11 times. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Fasten off. 96 sts.
ARMREST CAPS (make 2)
With MC, ch 14.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 lnkhdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 hdc in first st. Lnkhdc2tog. 1 lnkhdc in each st to last 3 sts. Lnkhdc2tog. 1 lnkhdc in last st. Turn. 8 sts at end of 2nd row.
Fasten off.
ARMREST COVER
With MC, ch 54.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 lnkhdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 52 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 16" [40.5 cm] ending on a WS row. Fasten off. 
Cut and Assemble Foam
Place Back Panel on 3" [7.5 cm] thick foam as shown in Foam Cutting Diagram I. Trace around perimeter. Cut foam working on the inside of each line.
Cut a rectangle measuring 9" x 13" [23 x 33 cm] using 3" [7.5 cm] thick foam for Armrest.
Using a serrated knife, bevel top corners of Armrest as shown in diagram. 
Cut a rectangle measuring 24 x 13" [61 x 33 cm] using 5" [12.5 cm] foam for Seat.
Using a spray adhesive, attach Back of Chaise foam pieces together.
As shown in Foam Assembly Diagram I on page 10. 
Attach Armrest to Base of Chaise using spray adhesive. Note that Armrest is not attached to Back of Chaise.
SEAMING CHAISE COVER
See Flat Seaming Diagrams on page 11.
Miter Left Front Corner
Match points marked A and B as indicated in Flat Seaming Diagrams.
With RS facing and using a whipstitch, seam tog from A/B to C as shown in Finished Seaming Diagrams. 
Align Armrest Cover with Seat as marked by C and D in Flat Seaming Diagrams. With RS facing and using a whipstitch, seam tog from K to F as shown in Flat Seaming Diagrams.
PM 5½" [14 cm] in from Seat on each side of Armrest Cover as shown in Flat Seaming Diagrams for points K and F. 
PM at center of both Front and Back Armrest Caps for U and Q as shown in Flat Seaming Diagram. 
PM 5" [12.5 cm] up from base of Front and Back Armrest caps, noting that marker is placed on left side of Front Armrest Cap and on the right side of Back Armrest Cap as shown in Flat Seaming Diagrams.
Joining Front Armrest Cap
See Finished Seaming Diagrams on page 11.
With RS facing, match the following pairs and tack tog using safety pins, locking stitch markers, or waste yarn as follows: Match E to W, X to F, U to G, and H to V. Using a whipstitch, seam tog from E/W to H/V.
Joining Back Armrest Cap
See diagrams on page 12.
With RS facing, match the following pairs and tack tog using safety pins, locking stitch markers, or waste yarn as follows: match T to I, Q to J, and K to R. Using a whipstitch, seam tog from T/I to K/R.
Make and Join Gusset
With MC, ch 14.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 lnkhdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 lnkhdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until Gusset measures length to fit along back of Seat. 
With RS facing, tack Gusset to Seat at following points using safety pins, locking stitch markers, or waste yarn as follows: S, L, M, N, O and A.
Seam tog using whipstitch, replacing markers to be visible on RS of work when finished.
Join Back Panel
With RS facing, align Back Panel to Gusset tack tog using safety pins, locking stitch markers, or waste yarn, ensuring that the points indicated along Back Panel correspond to markers along Seat.
Seam tog using whipstitch from Y to X, X to A3, A3 to A2.
FRINGE
With A, ch 161.
**1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 160 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. *Sl st in next sc. Draw up a loop 9" [23 cm] long. Twist loop 25 times. Sl st in same st, allowing twisted loop to coil around itself twice. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Fringe around base of Chaise as shown, with top of Fringe positioned approx 3½" [9 cm] above Base, and starting at F/X as indicated in Finished Seaming Diagrams and ending at A11.
Twisted Cord (make 2).
Cut 6 lengths of A 62" [157.5 cm] long. With all strands tog, hold one end and with someone holding other end, twist strands to the right until they begin to curl. Fold the 2 ends tog and tie in a knot so they will not unravel. The strands will now twist themselves tog. Adjust length of each cord to fit around Front Armrest Cap from W/E to G/U to V/H, joining ends in corners. Note: Cord ends will be concealed when Base is attached.

materials: Caron® Kindness™ (7 oz/198 g; 345 yds/315 m)
Contrast A Dark Navy (53005) 2  3  4    5 balls
Contrast B Fog (53009) 2  3  4    5 balls
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Quilt batting.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements:
Diameter approx:
S 16" [40.5 cm]
M 22" [56 cm]
L 34" [86.5 cm]
XL 40" [101.5 cm]
gauge: 8 dc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held tog and larger hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to all sizes.
Notes: Base and Edging are worked with 1 strand each of A and B held tog throughout. Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Base (make 2)
With 1 strand each of A and B held tog and larger hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 72 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 84 dc.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 96 dc.
Sizes M, L and XL only: 9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 108 dc.
10th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 120 dc.
11th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 132 dc.
Sizes L and XL only: 12th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 144 dc.
13th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 156 dc.
14th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 12 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 168 dc.
15th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 180 dc.
Cont in same manner, inc 12 sts every rnd as before until there are (216-252) sts.
All sizes: Fasten off.
Edging
With 1 strand each of A and B held tog and larger hook, ch 98 (134-218-254).
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 96 (132-216-252) dc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next dc. Dcbp around next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep last row until Edging measures approx 5 (5-6-7)" [12.5 (12.5-15-18) cm]. Do not fasten off.
Join sides tog, working 1 row of sc through both thicknesses. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Cut quilt batting to match outer measurement of Base.
With WS of Base pieces tog and larger hook, join A and B tog in any dc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 sc in each dc around, stopping just past halfway point to place quilt batting inside Base. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Position Edging around outside edge of Base, stretching just slightly to fit. With larger hook, join A and B tog with sl st to any sc around Base. Ch 1. Join Edging to Base, working 1 rnd of sc through both thicknesses. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Button Cover
With 1 strand of B and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 24 sts. Insert button.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 16 sts. Insert button.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Attach Button to center of Base, making sure to secure tightly through all thicknesses to bottom of Base.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Big™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 32 yds/29 m) Chalk Pink (26023) 3 balls
Size U.S. S (19 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 18" [45.5 cm] diameter x 7" [18 cm] deep.
instructions:
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th to 10th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of 10th rnd.
